CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 6+6-3-c - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing) (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Article 6-3-c - Defence through legal assistance);Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life (Article 8-1 - Respect for correspondence);Violation of Article 9 - Freedom of thought, conscience and religion (Article 9-1 - Freedom of religion)

The court also noted that the outcome of the ballistic examination as to the distance , trajectory and angle of the entry wounds had not matched the applicant ’s version of events .
